title: WCAS HISTORY 366-0-20 Race and Nation in the Independence Era

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Spring 2016 topic: "The Indian Problem" Independence from Spain intensified longstanding debates about race, citizenship, and nation that remain ongoing in Latin America up to the present. Would people of American descent enjoy full citizenship in the new nation-states? What role would American civilizations, cultures, symbols, and languages play in forging national identities? This thematic survey of Latin America in the national era examines the political, cultural, ideological, and economic foundations of discrimination and inequality in the region. History 365 or an equivalent introduction to Latin America is encouraged, but not required.
